text: Robert Patrick "Bob" Casey, Sr. (January 9, 1932 - May 30, 2000) was an American politician from Pennsylvania. A member of the Democratic Party, he served as the 42nd Governor of Pennsylvania from 1987 to 1995. He previously served as a state senator (1963–68) and Auditor General of Pennsylvania (1969–77). Casey died at the age of 68 from a rare disease called amyloidosis in Scranton, Pennsylvania. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Deaths from amyloidosis Category:Governors of Pennsylvania Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:20th-century American politicians Category:American Roman Catholics Category:Lawyers from Pennsylvania Category:Members of the Pennsylvania General Assembly
title: Robert P. Casey
